meanings.definition: To reverse one's previous position or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She backpedals on her decision to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: He often backpedals when faced with criticism.
meanings.sent3: The politician backpedals on his promise to lower taxes.
meanings.sent4: Her backpedals on environmental issues are disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The student backpedals on his essay topic after receiving feedback.

meanings.definition: To retreat or move backwards, especially while riding a bicycle.
meanings.sent1: He backpedals cautiously to avoid hitting the curb.
meanings.sent2: She quickly backpedals when she sees the obstacle ahead.
meanings.sent3: The child backpedals on the bike to show off to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The cyclist skillfully backpedals to maintain balance on the steep slope.
meanings.sent5: Backpedaling on the bike requires coordination and practice.

meanings.definition: To make excuses or retract a statement.
meanings.sent1: He always backpedals when caught in a lie.
meanings.sent2: She tends to backpedal instead of admitting her mistake.
meanings.sent3: The employee backpedals on his error to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her habit of backpedaling only worsens the situation.
meanings.sent5: Backpedaling may temporarily save face but damages credibility in the long run.
